intro: Bomarea diffracta, commonly known as the pink bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features tuberous roots and has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
